title: Convert to Exponential Form
text: First, convert the expression to exponential form. To convert a logarithmic equation to exponential form, we need to identify the base of the exponential, a, and the exponent y since $$y=\log_{a}\left(x\right)$$ is equivalent to $$x=a^y$$.

title: Determining the Exponential Form
text: What is the exponential form of the equation?

title: Rewrite $$\frac{1}{27}$$ with base $$\frac{1}{3}$$
text: Since $$3^3=27$$, we can actually rewrite $$\frac{1}{27}$$ in terms of $$\frac{1}{3}$$. What is $$\frac{1}{27}$$ equal to in terms of $$\frac{1}{3}$$?

title: Solve for x
text: Substituting $${\left(\frac{1}{3}\right)}^3$$ into the exponential equation we found before, we get $${\left(\frac{1}{3}\right)}^x={\left(\frac{1}{3}\right)}^3$$. What is the solution for x in this exponential equation?
